etymologies: late 16th century: probably via Dutch from obsolete French truffle, perhaps based on Latin tubera, plural of tuber ‘hump, swelling’. truffle (sense 2) dates from the 1920s

definitions: a strong-smelling underground fungus that resembles an irregular, rough-skinned potato, growing chiefly in broadleaved woodland on calcareous soils. It is considered a culinary delicacy and found, especially in France, with the aid of trained dogs or pigs.

notes.text: Family Tuberaceae, subdivision Ascomycotina: Tuber and other genera

shortDefinitions: strong-smelling underground fungus that resembles irregular, rough-skinned potato, growing

definitions: a soft candy made of a chocolate mixture, typically flavored with rum and covered with cocoa.
shortDefinitions: soft sweet made of chocolate mixture
